# Data Source (hush_mongodb_access_credential)

Use this data source to retrieve information about a MongoDB access credential in the Hush Security platform.

## Example Usage

```terraform
data "hush_mongodb_access_credential" "example" {
  id = "acr-eu12345678"
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `id` (String) The unique identifier of the MongoDB access credential

### Read-Only

- `auth_source` (String) The authentication source database (default: admin)
- `db_name` (String) The name of the MongoDB database
- `deployment_ids` (List of String) List of deployment IDs that can access this credential
- `description` (String) The description of the MongoDB access credential
- `host` (String) The hostname or IP address of the MongoDB server
- `kind` (String) The kind of access credential
- `name` (String) The name of the MongoDB access credential
- `port` (Number) The port number of the MongoDB server (default: 27017)
- `tls` (Boolean) Whether to use TLS for the MongoDB connection (default: false)
- `tls_ca` (String) The TLS CA certificate for the MongoDB connection
- `type` (String) The type of access credential
- `username` (String) The username for the MongoDB connection
